string-array.name: electrolytes_q1
string-array.item: What is the difference between a nonelectrolyte and an electrolyte?

An aqueous solution of an electrolyte will conduct electricity, while a solution of a nonelectrolyte will not., A non-electrolyte is ionic in nature, while an electrolyte is molecular., An electrolyte is basic in aqueous solution, while a non-electrolyte is acidic., An electrolyte contains chloride atoms, while a non-electrolyte contains carbon atoms.
Electrolytes
As far as electrolytes in aqueous solutions are considered, An aqueous solution of an electrolyte will conduct electricity, while a solution of a nonelectrolyte will not.

string-array.name: electrolytes_q2
string-array.item: What is the equation used for determining molarity?
Molarity = moles of solute / liters of solution, Molarity = liters of solution / moles of solute,Molarity = moles of solvent / liters of solution, Molarity = liters of solution / moles of solvent
Electrolytes
By definition, molarity is moles of solute divided by liters of solution.

string-array.name: electrolytes_q3
string-array.item: A solution in which [H+] = 10–8 M has a pH of … and is ...
8, basic, 8, acidic, -6, basic, 6, basic
Electrolytes
pH is 8 and medium is basic

string-array.name: electrolytes_q4
string-array.item: A solution in which [H+] = 10–8 M has a pH of … and is ...
8; basic, 8; acidic, -6; basic, 6; basic
Electrolytes
pH is 8 and medium is basic

string-array.name: electrolytes_q5
string-array.item: What is the concentration of ammonium chloride in a solution if its pH is 4.80?
Electrolytes
The calculation is based on dissociation constant of ammonium hydroxide.
